decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board using powerful planeswalkers like Garruk, Nissa, and Oko. With efficient removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Aether Gust, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats at bay while generating card advantage through Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all three colors (green, black, and blue) to ensure the player can cast their spells effectively and adapt to different situations.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Hydroid Krasis. It also incorporates disruptive elements like Aether Gust to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the green and blue cards in the deck, with some utility lands like Mobilized District and Temple of Mystery. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to consistently pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Cauldron Familiar, Gutterbones, and Cavalier of Night, while also utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Mayhem Devil and Priest of Forgotten Gods. Claim the Firstborn can help disrupt the opponent's strategy by stealing their creatures, and cards like Chandra, Acolyte of Flame and Midnight Reaper provide card advantage. Angrath's Rampage and Noxious Grasp serve as removal spells to control the board, while Witch's Oven can be used to create additional sacrifice triggers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish them off quickly.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko, along with removal and disruption spells like Noxious Grasp and Casualties of War. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf. The deck also includes cards like Once Upon a Time for consistency and Fabled Passage for mana fixing. The ultimate goal is to outvalue and outclass the opponent through a combination of powerful creatures, planeswalkers, and removal spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Prison Realm, while using Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's plays. Fires of Invention allows for casting multiple spells each turn without paying their mana cost, enabling huge swings in momentum. The Cavaliers provide both aggression and card advantage, with Kenrith, the Returned King offering a versatile finisher. The deck also includes a wishboard with Fae of Wishes for additional flexibility in finding the right answers for different matchups. The mana base is optimized for consistency and access to all colors needed.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using cards that generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Vraska, Golgari Queen, Once Upon a Time, and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also having answers to threats through cards like Massacre Girl and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King. The deck also focuses on creating a strong board presence with cards like Mayhem Devil, Midnight Reaper, and Wicked Wolf, while also utilizing Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven combo for additional value. The mana base is designed to have consistent access to all necessary colors.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful Planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa to dictate the pace of the game. Generating mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Gilded Goose allows for explosive plays with cards like Mass Manipulation and Hydroid Krasis. With a mix of removal spells like Time Wipe and versatile threats like Oko, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and stabilize the board until it can take over the game with its powerful late-game threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to stall the game until it can establish a strong board presence with cards like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Dance of the Manse. The deck also utilizes artifacts like Golden Egg and Guild Globe to draw cards and gain life to outlast the opponent. By controlling the board state and resources, it looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on gaining control of the game through powerful planeswalkers and creature removal spells, while generating additional value from its lands and creatures. By using cards like Liliana, Nissa, and Oko, alongside Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to outvalue opponents in the late game. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Murderous Rider to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to grind out opponents with its powerful planeswalkers and generate incremental advantage to win the game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Wicked Wolf, while generating card advantage and ramping up mana with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Oko, Thief of Crowns to further assert dominance over the game. By carefully managing resources and making efficient use of its versatile cards, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in long, grindy matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to generate card advantage and control the game by using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By ramping up with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, the deck aims to cast powerful late-game spells like Expansion / Explosion. The deck also focuses on card selection and scrying with Opt and Castle Vantress, ensuring that the player has the right answers at the right time. Overall, the goal is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the board while ramping up mana through Fires of Invention. By casting spells for free on alternate turns, the deck can play powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Cavalier of Gales while still having mana available to answer the opponent's plays with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Fae of Wishes and Realm-Cloaked Giant to handle a variety of situations. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and pave the way for a decisive victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures, while also using adventure cards for added value and versatility. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Vivien, along with efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Rankle. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End, while also generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent gameplay.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game through the use of Fires of Invention, allowing the player to cast spells without paying their mana cost. By utilizing powerful control elements like Prison Realm and Cavalier of Flame, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating advantage through card draw and creature removal. The deck also includes a toolbox of versatile spells and creatures, such as Kenrith, the Returned King and Fae of Wishes, to adapt to different situations and close out the game efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the Adventure mechanic to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures and powerful effects. By playing cards like Once Upon a Time to find key pieces and Incubation / Incongruity to support the strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure. Ajani, the Greathearted helps to further boost the team, while cards like Venerated Loxodon and Lovestruck Beast offer efficient threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Kraul Harpooner and Giant Killer to deal with opposing threats and maintain control of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to gain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Chemister's Insight, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in order to establish a dominant position on the board. With efficient removal in Bonecrusher Giant and Flame Sweep, as well as counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own strategy towards victory.
